Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma's India scored 285/7 in 50 overs in the 2018 Asia Cup match against Hong Kong.
Hong Kong scored 174 without loss but lost wickets in a heap to lose by 26 runs.
Nizakat Khan (92) and Anshy Rath (73) contributed significantly to Hong Kong's score.
Hong Kong's greatest achievement in T20I format came in 2014 when they defeated Bangladesh in the first round of the T20 World Cup.
Hong Kong has a reputation for causing upsets and is expected to challenge India in the upcoming Asia Cup matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Hong Kong's team comprises mainly of expatriates from Pakistan.
The team has had a challenging period since 2018 due to the pandemic.
Nizakat Khan and Kinchit Shah are reliable with bat and ball.
Babar Hayat is a top-order hitter for Hong Kong.
Ayush Shukla and Yasim Murtaza represent the future of the Hong Kong team.
Hong Kong is likely to play the same XI that defeated UAE in the Asia Cup Qualifier.
